title: Representing the numerators symbolically
text: The first step is to use variables like A, B, C, etc. for the constant numerators and $$Ax+B$$ for the numeratores of each quadratic factor in the denominator.
speech: The first step is to use variables like A, B, C, etc. for the constant numerators and ,   a x plus   b  for the numeratores of each quadratic factor in the denominator.
pacedSpeech: The first step is to use variables like A, B, C, etc. for the constant numerators and  ,   a x plus   b
for the numeratores of each quadratic factor in the denominator.

title: Using the definition of partial fraction decomposition
text: For each of the denominators in the decomposed form, give each numerator a symbolic label, like A, B, or C.
speech: For each of the denominators in the decomposed form, give each numerator a symbolic label, like A, B, or C.
pacedSpeech: For each of the denominators in the decomposed form, give each numerator a symbolic label, like A, B, or C.

title: Remove the denominator
text: Multiply both sides by the common denominator. On the right side of the equation, expand and collect like terms.
speech: Multiply both sides by the common denominator. On the right side of the equation, expand and collect like terms.
pacedSpeech: Multiply both sides by the common denominator. On the right side of the equation, expand and collect like terms.

title: Finding the resulting equation
text: Expand the right side of the equation and collect like terms
speech: Expand the right side of the equation and collect like terms
pacedSpeech: Expand the right side of the equation and collect like terms

title: Setting up the system of equations
text: Set coefficients of like terms from the left side of the equation equal to those on the right side to create a system of equations to solve for the numerators
speech: Set coefficients of like terms from the left side of the equation equal to those on the right side to create a system of equations to solve for the numerators
pacedSpeech: Set coefficients of like terms from the left side of the equation equal to those on the right side to create a system of equations to solve for the numerators
